programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a high-powered amateur rocket and a piece of machinery used for mining gold at a storage unit in Littleton, Colorado.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An English bidder turns up at Fort Worth. Victor acquires some spy equipment, while Ricky and Bubba have their eyes on something far more dangerous.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba plan to get revenge on a rival at an auction in Dallas, and arguments erupt surrounding a musical instrument.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit the editor of Motorcycle magazine, who has decided to put some of his collection of rare bikes up for sale.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunting season is threatened when cold weather drives the alligators away. Two swampers plan to look for prey in warmer waters - but that means jumping a 50-foot levee.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines one of the rarest guns in American history, and a tyre that once belonged to Nascar driver Dale Earnhardt.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are thrilled at the chance to buy a dollar bill signed by Clark Gable, while Rick gets his hands on a memento of one-time US president Ulysses S Grant's funeral.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Pilot of the series following colourful life in a large pawn shop, as run by the Gold family. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man brings in a boer head in hope of a trade, and a woman wants cash for a fur coat despite the summer heat. Series following life in a large pawn shop..

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Paul tries to persuade his son that they should purchase lockers with an odd number after a lucky poker win, and Ursula buddies up with her pet chinchilla.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Tensions among the buyers are at an all-time high, with the stress of competition on the auction circuit and the buyers facing major decisions with new business ventures.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Auctions in Garland bring a day of dashed hopes and sweet profits. Plus, a new buyer begins to throw some of the bidders off their game.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer stirs up trouble when he joins as bidder.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe shows up at tense auctions in Mesquite, where struggling Victor proves he is desperate for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa Lewis and Jerry Simpson compete against Jenny Grumbles and Mary Padian at an auction on their own turf in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An English bidder turns up at Fort Worth. Victor acquires some spy equipment, while Ricky and Bubba have their eyes on something far more dangerous.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba plan to get revenge on a rival at an auction in Dallas, and arguments erupt surrounding a musical instrument.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary shows a different side to her personality in Dallas and soon has a roaring crowd on its feet. Meanwhile, Ricky and Bubba are led astray by their latest find.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Fort Worth witnesses a showdown when Cowboy Matt begins throwing his weight around. Jenny's wins a locker containing a very strange item.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: A priceless relic of a statue of Christ unearthed on a shipwreck in Madagascar launches dive expert Barry Clifford and historian Scott Wolter on a worldwide investigation to find out if there is a link between two of history's most legendary sects - 17th-century pirates and the medieval Knights Templar.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Scott Wolter follows the trail of the legendary Knights Templar to Portugal, where he learns some stunning new information that breaks the investigation wide open. Meanwhile, in Madagascar, Barry Clifford switches the team's focus to a wreck he believes is Captain Kidd's warship - and makes a groundbreaking discovery.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff get the chance to buy a rare 1970s Indian mini-motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a classic 1967 Rokon Trailbreaker motorbike and a collection of rare Muhammad Ali memorabilia. They also have to decide whether a 1715 Escudo Spanish gold coin is a fake.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff value a peg-leg pistol, and four school yearbooks signed by movie icon James Dean.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit some of the most expensive items in the shop as Pawn Stars splash the cash for a 1961 Fender Stratocaster guitar, Mickey Mouse display items and Star Wars memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the Pawn Stars' archive, including a Civil War veteran's rifle and a campaign ribbon from Lincoln's first election in 1860

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The fiercest negotiations in Pawn Stars history, including the deal for Elton John's boots, a James Bond toy car and an ancient Roman coin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The greatest treasures and biggest disappointments in Pawn Star history, including a violin with million-dollar potential and a document signed by John Hancock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A first edition of The Adventures of Bob Hope comic gets Rick and Chum chuckling, and an ancient Egyptian mummy mask gets Corey all wrapped up.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor unearth artefacts from former military sites across the UK, starting with a German bomber found in Liverpool.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.sub-title: Douglas Bader and the Duxford Fliers
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor hunt for souvenirs left by flying ace Douglas Bader and the legendary Duxford Fliers.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff, Ton Jones and their feisty new assistant find a pair of high-tech gadgets and a vintage sled at a lively auction in Honolulu.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones put their bidding skills to the test against Hawaiian locals, and discover a vintage motor scooter and some antique Polynesian tattoo tools.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Hurricane Florence brings biblical flooding to North Carolina, a magnitude 7 earthquake rocks Alaska, and a surfer crashes in Nazareâ€™s colossal waves.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at how a three-man crew on DHL A300 battled against the plane's failing hydraulics as a routine mail flight turned into a fight for their lives.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor unearth artefacts from former military sites across the UK, starting with a German bomber found in Liverpool.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff is late to the auction, leaving Ton Jones to bid for a bow-and-arrow set and a flame-thrower by himself.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The competition is tough in Ton Jones's home town of Antelope Valley, California, where the guys manage to pick up two cheap units.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The rivals find themselves confronted with an intimidating man in gold chains - the Mayor of Chesham. Greg Davies hosts, while Richard Osman and Doc Brown also appear.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, with regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by Rebecca Front, Jack Whitehall, Nick Hewer and Miranda Hart, who try to deceive their opponents with plausible lies and absurd facts about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Robert Webb, Terry Wogan, Katy Wix and Kevin Bridges on the panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The gang rally round Kryten when he has a mid-life crisis and try to show him how much he has achieved by taking him to visit a mechanoid from his old fleet. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer comes face to face with Ace, his double from another dimension, but finds the uncanny resemblance is purely physical. His counterpart is brave, successful, selfless and popular - everything Rimmer is not. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of criminal Mark Johnson, who was killed in a fire at London's Union club in 1996. The original investigation was hampered by silence among witnesses and associates, but with new information suggesting the blaze was a targeted arson attack, the detectives hope they will have more success. Drama, guest starring Roy Marsden, Martin Marquez and Tom Watt.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a horrendous car crash, Pearce is forced to relive a fatal incident when he attends the resulting inquest and Nick is puzzled by a message from Ariadne.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark gets the thumbs-up in his psychiatric report and rejoins the Fusiliers, determined to make a fresh start. Unfortunately, CSM Fitzpatrick isn't convinced he is up to the job and resolves to make life difficult for him, with disastrous consequences for Tony and Jacko.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jessica Bailey finds it a struggle to fit in amongst the regiment, and an officer makes Chris McLeod jealous after he returns from leave.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lola's daughter comes to the hospital with her boyfriend, who has reacted badly to a tetanus injection. However, the news that they are planning to go travelling together does not go down well. Sam advises a patient to fake her symptoms to increase her chances of getting into surgery, with disastrous consequences. Michael French rejoins the cast as consultant Nick Jordan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Eve's friend Gerry is rushed into A&E, forcing her to make a drastic decision, while Holly's attempts to reunite an estranged family meet unexpected complications. Hospital drama, starring Ian Bleasdale, Cathy Shipton and Barbara Marten.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam tries to defuse the threat of strike action by the relief, reminding them of their duties as police officers and offering to let Yvonne return to the station while the inquiry takes its course. Dan reacts with dismay when Rochelle suggests they put their affair on hold, Gary chafes under Suzie's condescending attitude, and Samantha looks on in disbelief as the simmering hostility between brothers Phil and Steve erupts into violence.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur has an unexpected visitor. Phil discovers a new drinking partner. Frank gets a hot tip and Hattie is forced to accept Ian's plans for the future.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel has a dream date. Frank is out of his depth. Greg Hewitt has news for Arthur and Christine.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: What's Santa Brought for Nora Then?
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. Compo has difficulty thinking of what to get Nora for Christmas, so decides to consult Auntie Wainwright for advice. Bill Owen stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A man is murdered at the unveiling of a new church clock and the cleric must act quickly before an innocent woman is sent to the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest becomes involved with a theatrical family when he discovers that a drowning initially thought to be a tragic accident was actually a murder. Drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Josephine Butler and Julian Wadham.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After a man is found hanging in the conservatory following a poetry recital, the priest soon realises he could not have committed suicide, and the search for a murderer begins. Drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: A movie crew from Hollywood arrives in the village to make a film, and pesky pensioners Compo, Clegg and Foggy manage to get themselves roped in as extras. Norman Wisdom guest stars, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The residents are troubled by a bicycle, and Compo's lucky rabbit's foot causes even more problems, while Sid tries his best to avoid Ivy. Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Michael Bates star in the long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Two sisters are found gassed in their home - one a talented author, the other with a terrible secret - and when only one survives, foul play is suspected.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia is horrified to find an injured man stuck in a tree on her estate, apparently thrown there from a passing train on an overhead viaduct. When Sid is implicated as the guilty party, Father Brown is left to clear his name - but only if he is truly innocent. Mystery drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The Church of Apollo comes to Kembleford and Susie is immediately drawn to Kalon, its charismatic leader. After his wife is murdered, Father Brown must break his spell over Susie or risk losing her for ever. Drama, starring Kasia Koleczek, Michael Maloney and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clergyman is called in to investigate when two nuns die in unusual circumstances at St Agnes convent. However, the mystery attracts the attention of Sister Boniface, a would-be sleuth with a passion for detective novels. Crime drama remake, guest starring comedienne Lorna Watson.

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: First episode of Ken Russell's four-part adaptation of DH Lawrence's controversial novel. An aristocratic woman trapped in a sexless marriage embarks on a passionate affair with a gamekeeper. Joely Richardson and Sean Bean star.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Now reunited with Katy, Laura takes drastic measures to hold the person framing her to account in a last-ditch bid for her freedom. But first, she must discover his identity and where he's hiding. To achieve what she needs to prove her innocence, she is forced to collude with the most surprising of people and the shocking truth of what happened on the morning Andrew died is finally revealed. Conclusion of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Coronavirus: How Safe Are Our Jobs? Tonight
programme.desc: Just a couple of months ago the economy was riding high with employment at record levels. But that was before the coronavirus epidemic tightened its grip on Britain, ripping up the way of life. In the past 14 days half a million people have signed on for Universal Credit. With the Government projected to spend many tens of billions in a bid to keep the economy, and jobs, afloat, Sonali Shah investigates: how safe are British jobs?.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James and fellow chef Mark Jordan discover the culinary delights of Guernsey. They sample local speciality Gache cake and a seafood platter fit for a king, while James uses the island's native dairy produce to make a creamy rice pudding with chargrilled peaches. The duo set themselves a fishing challenge by attempting to catch a mighty turbot, and James finishes the day by cooking a mouthwatering turbot dish.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a male voice choir answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to Â£1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Bristol.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Mandy insists on planning Lydia's hen night, as well as Sam's stag, but Lydia is unsure. Paddy agrees to Jamie's plan and Rodney struggles running the cafÃ©.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve regrets prioritising Emma's needs over Oliver's, Gemma returns home and finally admits to Chesney that she thinks she's a terrible mother and no longer feels in control, while Ken decides to challenge Charles' supremacy.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of 29-year-old Niall is made difficult by those closest to him, who seem intent on obscuring the facts, and it is not until the body of a drug dealer washes up on a beach that the dreadful truth begins to emerge. While coping with revelations of her own, Vera sifts through evidence of the grief, love and addiction that characterised Niall's life as she tries to find out why someone wanted him dead. With Judy Parfitt (Call the Midwife) and Phyllis Logan (Downton Abbey).

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: The Theory of Everything (2014)
programme.desc: Biopic of Stephen Hawking, exploring the renowned astrophysicist's romance with future wife Jane during their time at university in the 1960s and his initial diagnosis with motor neurone disease, which doctors believed would lead to his death within two years. Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue their project to make a classic Porsche 924 fit for the road.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: One of Bruce Crompton's clients wants a half-track armoured personnel carrier converted into a Pioneer variant, as used by the German army during the Battle of the Bulge.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a complex hybrid chopper for an electrics company, and the rift within the Teutul family continues when Paul Sr angrily returns a motorcycle to his son.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy calls in his team to snag a Czechoslovakian fighter jet, and Ken Cage and Danny Thompson end up under fire after going after a $2million Citation CJ1.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe learns the art of concrete finishing - but discovers the job is considerably more demanding than he had anticipated.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A detailed analysis of how car headlamps, directional drills and combs are made. Plus, an insight into the special skills involved in stained-glass restoration.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Handcrafted Skis/Septic Tanks/Hydroformed Chassis Parts/Aquarium Windows
programme.desc: The manufacturing documentary continues, exploring the making of handcrafted skis, septic tanks, hydroformed chassis pants, and aquarium windows.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard barters with a baronet and is given a run for his money by a seasoned scavenger. He also seeks a way to profit from a collection of late 19th-century balconet rails he has acquired.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard explores the world's biggest travelling vintage funfair, and a Windsor pub where everything is for sale. Plus, an illuminations depot in Blackpool that is packed with pop art.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard searches for new items to restock his shop, and finds a wealth of industrial fixtures at a former RAF base, as well as visiting a warehouse in Brighton.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finds a Devon salvage yard filled with interesting pieces. He also visits an inventor in Battle, East Sussex, whose collection includes a mummified cat.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard calls on some legendary hoarders such as Chris, who collects cement mixers and has an herbaceous car park. His hope is that he will be able to persuade someone to sell their stuff.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John take a road trip in Hungary. In Budapest, they visit one of the country's biggest antique markets. Later, they unearth treasures in a former communist factory.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard hits the Giant Shepton Flea Market, where he unearths some retro design classics. Plus, in Devon, he visits Europe's largest repository of vintage fairground rides.objects.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: iDrew Pritchard hts the road with upholsterer Craig. In Derbyshire a 15th-century house has some Victorian dining chairs with potential, and the duo also visit an antique centre in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours a Surrey sculpture park, where a pair of rare 18th-century church lych-gates catches his eye. In London, he visits a small showroom with big character.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Drew Pritchard finds a stunning collection of antique cutler's stools. Later, he heads to Leeds where he finds some rare streetlights at a heritage railway and museum.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours a Cheshire barn packed with items, from traditional antique furniture to taxidermy. In Sheffield, he uncovers a collection of early 20th-century glass eyes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revive a rare and valuable fairground ride, then resuscitate a Victorian park bench and a century-old gentleman's suitcase.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Porsche 924 in an attempt to make it roadworthy again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue their project to make a classic Porsche 924 fit for the road.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit a stately home in Somerset, where Simon is convinced he has uncovered a genuine Tudor relic.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Architectural salvage expert Drew Pritchard visits a private school with a cellar full of furniture. Then he heads for Glastonbury, Somerset, on a hunt for new stock.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: After finding evidence of a 1700s-era lifeboat near shore, Darrell and the team discover the shipwreck it came from, but a sudden tragedy hits the expedition.

programme.title: Top 10 Mysteries and Conspiracies
programme.desc: The enigmatic events and unexplained phenomena that have piqued curiosity throughout history, culminating in the number one mystery and conspiracy of all time.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Repairing cables on the seabed, manufacturing 10-gallon hats, and the process involved in feeding 100,000 air passengers a day.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Preventing planes from icing up in extremely cold conditions, the use of clay to make magazine pages glossy, and constructing a 125mph electric car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mechanic Edd China teams up with Mike Brewer to get a classic Saab 900 Turbo back on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China face the challenge of working to a tight budget as they continue with the Saab 900 Turbo restoration.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The mother of a bride-to-be tries to make her daughter feel guilty, while another mum refuses to relent on her love of a ballgown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Live for Today, Hope for Tomorrow
programme.desc: One bride has to battle her opinionated grandmother as she tries to find her dream dress, while another is forced to change wedding dates when her fiance receives bad news.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride has a panic attack while trying to unearth that elusive 'magic feeling', while another is 120 dresses into her bridal odyssey.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Two brides are forced to re-evaluate their wedding look, including one who needs to find a dress for an unexpected future.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The salon receives a visit from one of its fussiest customers yet, while a bubbly bride clashes with her pernickety posse.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Say No to the Ball Gown
programme.desc: A bride searches for anything but a pageant dress in defiance of her mother, while another continues the hunt after trying on 100 mermaid gowns.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate investigates why a rabbit has stopped eating. Plus, a sausage dog receives experimental treatment and Dr Peter helps a monkey with suspected tuberculosis.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Peter needs to remove a grass seed from a dog's eye. Dr Alex tries to fix a traumatised puppy that has been attacked and a massive dog comes in for a check-up.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic artists use the remains of unknown victims to draw conclusions which enable police to identify the body and begin a murder investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How insects and parasites at a crime scene can offer clues to a victim's time of death and unravel a seemingly concrete alibi.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A comparison between the work of crime writers and real-life accounts from homicide investigators, proving reality can be stranger than fiction.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how photographic evidence can provide vital information when investigators have no witnesses to a murder.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A look back at 10 years of documentation of the super-obese to highlight key breakthrough moments within their turbulent but ultimately triumphant weight-loss journey.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Twenty nine-year-old twins Brandi and Kandi are close after a traumatic childhood, seeing food as a comfort. After weight-loss surgery, more challenges await the pair.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Ashley, who at 670 pounds is desperate to save her life and her marriage to husband David. She is also hopeful weight-loss surgery can give her the chance for a family of her own.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three rivals head to a flea market in Jonzac, south-west France, to see who can buy the best bargains. They each have 800 euros and expert advice from dealer Mark Franks before heading out to shop. Helen spots the potential in some rusty old oyster baskets, Pauline gives an antique mirror a pink paint job, and Martin's upcycling gets personal as he creates a bespoke piece of artwork using some old watch fittings. They then sell their items in Brighton, with the collector who makes the most money walking away with everyone's profits.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou mixes business with pleasure as he heads to Spain to meet an entrepreneur friend who's looking to get a Â£100,000 loan on his luxury 18-metre yacht. A young widow finds it difficult to part with her late husband's vintage car to set up a new life in Croatia, jewellery expert Monika is shocked when she's asked to deal with a golden rat, and the shop staff struggle to put a price on some rare and problematic black coral statues.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Gideon, who weighs 650lbs, is desperate to address his problem, so uproots his family to restart his life with weight-loss surgery and hopes for a happier future.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: When a US marine veteran was found shot dead outside his New Mexico home, a lucky break led detectives to suspect his wife had links to the killer.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: Estephania LeBaron was raised to believe that her father and brothers were holy men justified in doing terrible things in God's name. However, she later began to question everything when faced with having to do the same terrible things herself.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: Kelly and Jason Cochran formed a killer husband-and-wife team. However, she afterwards turned on him. It is believed she may have killed another nine men. Cochran is also suspected of serving the dismembered remains of one victim at a barbecue for neighbours.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Fragments of bone recovered from a swamp help to identify the victim of a serial killer and bring the culprit to court, while forensic anthropologist Doug Owsley examines the skull of a female who died as a result of stabbing.
